meanings.definition: To remove or get rid of unwanted items or clutter from a space.
meanings.sent1: I need to clearout my closet to make more space.
meanings.sent2: Every spring, I clearout old clothes I no longer wear.
meanings.sent3: My mom asked me to clearout my room, but I found my old toys and got distracted.
meanings.sent4: She decided to clearout all negative thoughts from her mind.
meanings.sent5: The storm helped clearout the dead leaves from the garden.
meanings.sent6: After the party, we had to clearout the empty cups and plates.
meanings.sent7: It's important to clearout expired food from the fridge regularly.

meanings.definition: A sale or event where items are sold at a reduced price in order to clear out inventory.
meanings.sent1: The store had a clearout to sell last season's clothes.
meanings.sent2: I love going to clearout events to find good deals.
meanings.sent3: The clearout at the store attracted a lot of bargain hunters.
meanings.sent4: The clearout was so popular that they sold out of everything.
meanings.sent5: The clearout helped the store make space for new products.
meanings.sent6: During the clearout, I bought a new jacket at a great price.
meanings.sent7: The clearout sign outside the store caught my attention.
